TopicTitle: [WIP][1.9.x-1.12.x] Scatterer-atmospheric scattering (0.0838 - 14/08/2022) Scattering improvements, in-game atmo generation and multi-sun support

Edited:

In any case, I've updated the main download.

[@Galileo](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/profile/150430-galileo/) I added a setting for the sun's name, "mainSunCelestialBody" in the config. I haven't tested with kopernicus but it should work if you rename the Sun.

Tried latest one that is in the first post.

That nasty black things on horizon is still there but its a lot less a thing than it was for 1.1:

![p4OYdGO.png](http://i.imgur.com/p4OYdGO.png)

![7kkaqBV.png](http://i.imgur.com/7kkaqBV.png)

![TVlfyIc.png](http://i.imgur.com/TVlfyIc.png)

![z85VGhv.png](http://i.imgur.com/z85VGhv.png)

It was all my beloved 120 per second, double press on [M] key and it dropped to around 20, even for space center and main menu.

Hello, I apologise if this was discussed further than 5 pages back, but is the lack of scatterer sunflare in the tracking station intentional, or is the stock sunflare I see there a bug?

I see the scatterer one if I am in map view while in flight, just not in the tracking station.
Yeah, it doesn't work in the TrackingStation.

> 6 hours ago, blackrack said:
>

> not exactly a big deal
> 

They sure not, but why not add them to some distant future TODO list? There is sure a way to fix it. It may be dark and scary way, but I am sure it exists somewhere.

[@KerbalMan23](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/profile/160738-kerbalman23/) a picture being worth a thousand words is not meant to be taken literally in the case of reporting issues.

if you want Blackrack to even acknowledge your issue, then [follow the instructions in this post](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/topic/83212-how-to-get-support-read-first/)

Hey blackrack, I will be home soon and want to test out the new scatterer. my only question is this, will the newest version work in 1.1.3? The planet pack I'm working on is going to have to be released on 1.1.3 because kopernicus' future is uncertain for now with the dev being busy IRL. if not its all good. I was perfectly happy with the older versions as well

I'm having an issue with 1.2 Scatterer atmo on OSX 10.9: a "halo" appears around the planet, looking like the atmosphere rim inverted. Similar to [this issue](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/topic/103963-wip12-scatterer-atmospheric-scattering-v00250-28092016-12-compatibility/&do=findComment&comment=2423118) up close, although behavior at a distance is a bit different. 

Here's what it looks like in low orbit:

![4UY2iP5.png?1](http://i.imgur.com/4UY2iP5.png?1)

And here's what it looks like from high orbit and in map view:

![6XGCYv0.png?1](http://i.imgur.com/6XGCYv0.png?1)

Screenshots taken with other mods installed but the behavior is the same without them. Same issue occurs on all planets with atmo. I'm currently using the latest 1.2 version from the <abbr title="Original Post(er). The first post in a thread, or the person who posted it.">OP</abbr> (0.0250), but I've tried all the different .dll's and shaders posted on the past few pages and the ones that worked all shared this problem. I've also tried experimenting with the settings but can't find the one that would lower the hard outer edge down to the black band between the true atmosphere and the inverted one. 

For the time being I've disabled all the planet configs--so I can still use Scatterer's sunflare and terrain shadows at least--but I'd really love to be able to use its atmo effects again as well. I can post my player.log as well, if that would be helpful.
